result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Disbursements Journal Final - Criminal Bond Deposits (WISCTF)
Disbursement Journal - Cash bond converted to signature bond per Court Minutes.  The $2,500 cash bond to be considered as payment of restitution - paid directly to the Child Support Agency.
filed by the State
Counts 1, 2 & 3
filed by Atty Maxwell Bergner
Deferred Entry of Judgment Agreement /s/ PB 07/11/22

Cash bond of $2,500 to be amended to Signature bond of $2,500. Per PB 7-11-2022.
No special conditions.

11:09 AM Defendant Charles S Zastrow in court.  Attorney Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Charles S Zastrow. 

Court calls case.
Atty Pfeil states appearances.

Plea Questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. Deferred Entry of Judgment.
State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.
Attorney for defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Amended Information has just been filed. 

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1: Guilty.
Count 2: Guilty.
Count 3: Guilty.

Court questions defendant regarding plea questionnaire, waiver of constitutional rights and understandings.
Court advises defendant of elements the state must prove for the charge.
Court questions attorney for the defendant.
Court finds defendant's plea is freely, voluntarily, knowingly, and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge.
Court withholds the finding of guilty of Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3.
Clerk directed to WITHHOLD ENTRY of judgment of convictions this date.
Count 4: Dismissed and read in.
Count 5: Dismissed and read in.

Atty Pfeil makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Atty Bergner makes sentencing arguments to the court. 
Court questions counsel to understand the parameters and if this is an appropriate disposition or not.
Defendant addresses the Court prior to sentencing.
Defendant's father addresses the Court.

Cash bond that was posted February 6, 2020 is addressed.
Cash bond of $2,500 was posted by Sharon Zastrow, mother.
State believed that the cash bond was to be applied to the outstanding obligation.
Defense's intent was that the money is to go to child support.
Defendant understands the bond is to go to child support.

Bond is still in effect during this case.

BY THE COURT: 
Count 1 and Count 2 and Count 3:
Deferred Entry of Judgment for 3 years.

Court signs the judgment.

Bond is amended to $2,500 signature bond with all previous conditions.
The $2,500 be considered as payment of restitution, and is paid to child support agency directly.

11:50 AM Defendant Charles S Zastrow in courthouse but not in the courtroom.   Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Brian J Pfeil in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Maxwell Bergner in court for Charles S Zastrow. 

Court states that this may be a deferred entry of judgment.
Court questions the parties if this was the agreement.
Atty Bergner states that his client is not in the position to enter any pleas today due to health issues and these are stated on the record.
Court questions ADA Pfeil as to how he wishes to proceed and he states this on the record.
ADA Pfeil does not object to an adjournment and does not object to the defendant appearing via ZOOM in the future.
Atty Bergner does have the deferred entry of judgment agreement but it has not yet been signed by his client.
Court does indicate that this is a 2014 case and states the facts of the case on the record.
Court questions what will happen with the cash bond posted.  ADA Pfeil responds.
State is in compliance with victim rights notification.

BY THE COURT:
Court grants the adjournment.
Bond is continued
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 11, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 27, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on February 18, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Parties to provide any Discovery by 07-30-2021.
Motion in Limine, Witness lists and Jury Instructions by 08-06-2021.
Court will provide a scheduling order for the parties.  Jury trial - 12 person scheduled for September 14, 2021 at 08:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 19, 2021 at 10:30 am.

10:22 AM Defendant Charles S Zastrow in court with Attorney (Atty) Frederick B Melms. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty Melms states there is not an agreement at this time and the matter needs to be set for trial. 

State has complied with Victim Notification Statutes.
Victim is not present.

BY THE COURT:  Bond/conditions of bond are continued.  Jury trial scheduled for December 9, 2020 at 08:00 am.
Restitution Summary filed by the State
Victim Impact Statement filed by the State
Plea/sentencing hearing on May 29, 2020 at 10:00 am.

Pre-trial conference on March 9, 2020 at 10:00 am.

NOT GUILTY plea(s) entered.

BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.

04:08 PM Defendant Charles S Zastrow in court with Attorney (Atty) Frederick B Melms. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant waives right to preliminary hearing. 
Court questions defendant regarding waiver of preliminary hearing. 
Court questions attorney.
Court finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the preliminary hearing. 

BY THE COURT:  On the defendant's waiver of the preliminary hearing, the court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for March 9, 2020 at 10:00 am.
Bail/bond hearing on February 17, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on February 17, 2020 at 03:00 pm.
2/3/2020 Bond is amended from $7,500 cash bond to a $2,500 cash bond.

Court notes there is a bond modification.
Atty Melms makes arguments in support of the motion to modify bond. 
Atty Zell makes arguments in opposition to the motion to modify bond. 

BY THE COURT:  
The defendant did abscond.  Court believes the cash bond is appropriate but modifies to a $2,500 cash bond.

01:54 PM Defendant Charles S Zastrow appeared by video.  Attorney (Atty) Frederick B Melms in court. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives the preliminary hearing.

Atty Zell informs Atty Melm to complete the paperwork for the preliminary hearing to be held. 
  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2020 at 03:00 pm.

01:30 PM Attorney (Atty) Maxwell Bergner in court, defendant Charles S Zastrow not in court, in custody. Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Michael Daniel Zell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney  appeared by video for .

Court questions Atty Bergner.
Atty Zell makes statements.
Atty Bergner would request a lower cash bond of $1,000 and states his reasons on the record.
Court makes statements with regards to this case.
Defendant had been extradited back to Wisconsin.

State recommends a $10,000 cash bond with conditions as stated.  Initial appearance scheduled for February 3, 2020 at 01:30 pm.
